x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.potential_impact:
A crowdsourced and utility-integrated system to track electricity outages, restoration timelines, and community power quality, bringing transparency and accountability to power distribution.

Impacts

  • Improve citizen trust in power utilities through real-time status visibility.
  • Reduce downtime for small businesses dependent on electricity.
  • Enable analytics for national grid reliability improvement.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Frequent power cuts affect homes and businesses, but citizens rarely get accurate information on cause or restoration time.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: PowerTrackNow – Community Energy Outage and Restoration Monitor
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

This solution will use the products listed and not limited to the following;

  • Service Portal for user outage reporting and live updates.
  • IntegrationHub with DISCO APIs (or simulated data).
  • Flow Designer to trigger notifications when outages are resolved.
  • Performance Analytics to map grid performance by region.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

We would need power company API or data-sharing agreement, optionally, we can add SMS integration for rural communities.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

We might encounter data transparency from utility companies, also, there's the issue of managing real-time event scalability..
